TopicTitle: LLL - Lack Luster Labs - Development Thread

Articles.Content:
I love making half meter space planes, I always thought the 1 meter parts were too big for them

And rovers

now all I need is a cargo bay / hangar for them

First of all, I really, really, really like your parts (as does nearly everyone else ).

I think I may have found a bug though (or I am just too stupid/retarded to read the forums properly, in that case, please ignore me). Anyway, I get a problem with the Bailay Research Post (6 node);

as you can see in the picture, it stays greyed out (transparent), even though I (tried) properly attached it to the pod. It also does not give me any nodes to attach things to, and when I try moving the pod it leaves the Baily Post, while it is supposed to pick it up too (move the whole ship).

I tried reinstalling, reinstalling over a clean install, and turning my pc on and off . Did not work.

I am using it in conjuction with the following mods: TTModularWheels, B9 Aerospace, Firespitter, HaveASeat, Airship and KAS.

Can anyone help me out and shout at me where I'm wrong?
at the moment you have to attach that part using the top node

I love making half meter space planes, I always thought the 1 meter parts were too big for them

And rovers

now all I need is a cargo bay / hangar for them

Where is the download for that cockpit? I can't find it. Also what mod adds those jet intakes?

Where is the download for that cockpit? I can't find it. Also what mod adds those jet intakes?

for the jet intakes and a bunch of other parts : http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/half-meter-parts-and-other-useless-crap-r3/

for the cockpit I actually made the base model of the cockpit myself, Lack cleaned it up, modified it a bit, textured it and got it in game

I think ill leave it to Lack to decide if he wants to add it to the mod
Nice work on the cockpit, it really matches the aesthetic of the rest of the parts.

Also just in case you missed my previous question: do you have any plans for decouplers based on the designs on the rest of your parts?

I probably should, need to figure out how they work first, mind.

for the jet intakes and a bunch of other parts : http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/half-meter-parts-and-other-useless-crap-r3/

for the cockpit I actually made the base model of the cockpit myself, Lack cleaned it up, modified it a bit, textured it and got it in game

I think ill leave it to Lack to decide if he wants to add it to the mod

It'll definitely be going in with the next update, I'll need to neaten up the textures first, there's no detail as it stands. Be a few new parts coming out then actually.

Picture dump time.

(N.B. The extractor fan and radiator are from Shrogg's mod. Also, the bit at the top-right went a bit squiff due to a rough landing).

Edited May 16, 2013 by Lack
Nice! are those inflatable parts yours? I assume so due to the similar color scheme, also endcaps. What are the uniformly white, textured 2x1 parts? structural or...?

...

Lack- are you trying to make us desperate? We are mod junkies, and you keep flashing brilliant images in front of us...

Any idea when you would release this?

First try at re-creating the Mako from Mass Effect using your parts.

Man...I miss the Mako....
Better than that wet tissue piece of trash Hammerhead...
That inflatable module, and that Panel like at the front ship, What mods are that?

That inflatable module, and that Panel like at the front ship, What mods are that?

They're LLL, it's just me being a tease since as they're not released yet.

Nice! are those inflatable parts yours? I assume so due to the similar color scheme, also endcaps. What are the uniformly white, textured 2x1 parts? structural or...?

The 2x1 parts are the normal 2x1 structural hull, but lacking the painted on door, which I'm dropping in the next update. They're a relic from before I actually made an air-lock part.

Better look here (although I have textures down to 1/2 res):

Changing the way the fuel tanks are textured as well, makes having multiple ones a bit less garish. I've had the fuel one done for a while as you may have noticed in some of the previous screenshots.

Okay, yeah, that's more teasing. I'm primarily just brushing things up for the next update now (textures, .cfgs, etc.), that can take a fair bit of time. I'm also trying to fill in some gaps and add a few new interesting bits.

Edited May 17, 2013 by Lack
I see batteries and fiddly-bits. Looking great.
Please release the shields and inflated components!
Oh boy, please no more teasing!! we need a release now! i'm begging you
I just noticed that your batteries say batt man "batteries".
Craft File, Pleeeeeaaaaassse?
What does untextured adapators entail? Like will those not work or what?

What does untextured adapators entail? Like will those not work or what?

It just means that the adaptor parts (e.g. which smooth the transition from a 2.5m circular part to a 2x1 hull, or 2x1 to 1x1) don't have any detailed textures. They're just grey.

It just means that the adaptor parts (e.g. which smooth the transition from a 2.5m circular part to a 2x1 hull, or 2x1 to 1x1) don't have any detailed textures. They're just grey.

Which do to your excellent planning tends to match well with the textured versions anyways lol
I think the engines both radial and the pseudo-nuclear engine could use some color striping. Currently the transition is too harsh. Also decouplers whenever you get to it

I really want to thank you guys for some awesome parts. They've REALLY come in handy!

I'm one of the "test pilot crew" and I've been using them to build "stand-in" place-holder pods for the Space 1999 Eagles that Devogen has made over in the Wayland thread until he gets his standard pods finished. They look great! And the party trick of the doors on each side designating an area holding 8 Kerbals means that this Eagle can carry a total of 18 Kerbals! (8x2 in the pod, 2 in the cockpit pod)

I've also built a pod using the LLL parts (and a whole bunch of other bits and pieces) that serves as a portable Kethane prospector and Cracking Station. You can pick this thing up as an Eagle Pod and orbit with it to find Kethane sites and then land and drop it off and go get another one or some storage tanks while the first one mines and stores the sweet green! When the Kethane deposit is depleted, land, pick it up and move it elsewhere.

I've also used these parts to make an add-on that recreates the boarding tube structure on the Moonbase Alpha launchpad.

But the most ambitious thing the LLL Pack has assisted me in building is this - a recreation of the SHADO Moonbase from Gerry Anderson's other live action Sci-Fi show from the 70s - UFO.

I really want to thank you. Your parts have been invaluable and really make possible things work that otherwise just wouldn't be possible!
Been using your parts on my Laythe base, thanks.
hey could you add LLL themed bilding panels that are HUGE so we can make HUGE bases while keeping the part count down (and i just want more building pieces
